page.title: 10YARBOROUGH SPORTS CENTRE
page.content: Yarborough Sports Centre was opened in 1976 by Graham Taylor, then Manager of Lincoln City F.C. With the Centre was a 25 metre swimming pool, diving area and a beginner's pool. Also four squash courts, two outdoor tennis courts and gymnasium and sports hall. Also a 400 metre running track with grandstand and all track and field event facilities. Later on was built a 5-a-side football, all weather square and BMX track. Sharing the centre was Yarborough High School, (built before the Centre), they use all the facilities. Swimming there is very cheap for three quarters of an hour. All facilities are open to the public, but all have to be payed for. A variety of clubs are held. The Centre is designed to relieve boredom amongst people and to get them involved in sport. Tim Priestley 13.
